Summary Objective:  
IT Consultant in Data Warehouse / Software Implementation and Development 
 
Summary:  
Roni Hidayat is a senior IT Consultant with more than 13 years experiences 
in area of Data Warehouse Implementation, Database Administration, Production System support, Software Development and Presales. 
His portfolio in technical skills include IBM Websphere DataStage, Oracle Exadata and Java/J2EE development.  
Some of the major clients he has worked with include Indosat, Telkomsel, LIPI and Kemendikbud. 
 
 
Highlights of Qualifications: 
Analyze, design, implement and support service of Data Warehouse/Software Development solutions 
Has insightful experience SDLC (software development life cycle) 
Has wide experience in different engagement models like onsite offshore, managed services 
Effectively interact with clients for technical and managerial activities and has been instrumental in building good relations with them Summary Objective:

Summary I have worked as an IT Consultant for over four years in a variety of roles and capacities including Enterprise Architecture, Solution Architecture, Business Analysis and Testing. However, the majority of my time has been spent as a Package Solution Designer. This role has involved creating technical designs for code and configuration changes to complex systems, triaging system defects and acting as a subject matter expert in order to translate technical aspects of the system into content understandable by a general client audience. 
 
I have completed a Master of Information Technology specialising in Health Technology. This specialisation focused on eHealth and biomedical informatics, information systems in health, biomedical and clinical data and knowledge, and health record management. As part of my studies I completed a thesis on the current application of wearable technologies to hand function rehabilitation after the event of stroke, which received First Class Honours. 
 
I have a strong interest in machine learning and data mining technologies which I have pursued as elective subjects during my postgraduate studies. During this time I developed skills with software packages Stata, SAS and Weka. I am continuing to pursue this area of interest through competitions and exercises on Kaggle and am using this as an avenue to learn to program in R. Experience Senior IT Consultant IBM July 2015  – Present (2 months) Wellington & Wairarapa, New Zealand IT Consultant IBM February 2014  –  June 2015  (1 year 5 months) Wellington & Wairarapa, New Zealand As an IT Consultant with IBM’s Global Business Services I have had the opportunity to work in a number of different roles on a number of different projects, mainly with New Zealand Government Clients. As part of IBM’s graduate programme I also had the opportunity to participate in a range of IBM official training on topics including Project Management, Leadership, Agile Methodology, and Presentation Skills. 
 
The majority of my experience has been in the Release and Deployment space, where I have developed a range of experience in process development, release documentation, shell scripting, release management and deployment management of up to 140 Java artifacts to a large and complex system. 
 
I also have experience in ITIL service management, focussing on Incident and Problem Management process in particular. This experience was gained in the Environments team on a large programme of work. 
 
During the latter part of 2014 I spent several months working as a Business Analyst on a Large Confidential Programme of work. In this time, I defined 50 high level business processes for a highly complex component of the solution, including traceability to business and system requirements. Historically, previous attempts to elaborate, define and deliver these processes has been unsuccessful.  Christmas Cookie Seller Cookie Time Limited October 2013  –  December 2013  (3 months) Porirua and the Kapiti Coast I had the pleasure of being part of the Cookie Time Christmas Cookies Campaign in 2013 as a Christmas Cookie seller to the Porirua/Kapiti region, just north of Wellington. 
 
As a Christmas Cookie Seller I ran my own business, managing everything from sales and marketing to stock management, distribution and banking. 
 
The campaign is run over about six weeks each year; three of these weeks are spent selling (essentially cold calling) thousands of businesses in my territory. The latter three weeks are spent delivering cookies; In the end I smashed my target of 3,000 buckets of cookies selling a total of 3,455 buckets - or roughly 293,675 Christmas Cookies.  
 
Frankly, life as a Christmas Cookie Seller was a lot tougher than I had anticipated. As a result of the limited time period in which Christmas Cookies are sold, visiting every business in my territory was tough and meant being on the road selling/delivering during business hours, before returning home to reply to emails, enter orders, count stock and load the car each night. At times, this meant I worked up to 19 hours a day and over 80 hours a week. Junior Associate First Monday August 2013  –  October 2013  (3 months) Wellington & Wairarapa, New Zealand As a Junior Associate at First Monday, I assisted the director in a variety of situations aiding the establishment of the business.  
 
Work included: Analysis of potential email, calendar and web site platforms, as well as a more technical perspective which included the implementation of the use of these systems within the business. Information Systems Tutor Victoria University of Wellington February 2012  –  June 2012  (5 months) Wellington I was an Academic Tutor for the School of Information Management, this meant tutoring classes of up to 20 students every fortnight. While at first it was daunting presenting to classes, this quickly changed as I realized how rewarding the position was and soon I was very relaxed presenting to classes. LPG Compliance Administrator Contact Energy Ltd May 2011  –  December 2011  (8 months) Wellington As LPG Compliance Administrator I worked with a project team to develop business processes and systems to support LPG Compliance Activities. The project faced significant pressure with heavy time constraints and regularly changing requirements but overall was a very rewarding experience.  
I also developed a variety of Microsoft Access Databases, including reports, forms and complicated queries.  
I was the subject matter expert for LPG Compliance within the business and therefore fielded a wide variety of inquiries from both inside and outside the business, including customers, test certifiers and the Environmental Protection Authority. 
At times, I managed mailouts to up to 1000 customers while facing significant data integrity challenges.  
Finally I also worked with retail trainers to develop training packs and call scripts used to train the customer services team. Compliance Telemarketing Assistant Contact Energy Ltd January 2011  –  May 2011  (5 months) In this role I was responsible for outbound calling to several thousand existing Contact Rockgas customers. New regulations were coming into effect which affected the storage and use of LPG, I communicated these changes to customers.  
Some customers faced having there LPG supply stopped as they did not meet new regulations, at times it was difficult to communicate this to customers as often LPG was an integral part of their business or home.  
As well as the aforementioned outbound calling, I also had several other responsibilities involving data entry, internal and external written stakeholder communications as well as liaising between staff across a variety of different business units. Sales Assistant Briscoe Group November 2008  –  December 2010  (2 years 2 months) Briscoes Porirua While at Briscoes, I attained a wide array of skills and competencies and developed a new found understanding of retailing. I was a member of the floor staff which involved interacting with customers throughout the work day. I also had a variety of other responsibilities, including check-out work and merchandising/stocking out. I was also given the role as a floor supervisor, which involved overseeing junior staff members’ work, and authorising particular sales transactions, which involved abnormal discounts or refunds. Hutt International Boys' School 2003  – 2010 Hutt International Boys' School 2003  – 2010 Hutt International Boys' School 2003  – 2010 Honors & Awards Highly Commended Journal Award Global Enterprise Experience 2013 May 2013 The Global Enterprise Experience is an international business competition which combines teams of up to eight students from all over the world to develop a business concept proposal in three short weeks. The business concept must address some form of world issue (the exact topic changes every year) but it also must be profitable and cannot rely on charity. 
 
At the end of the competition, participants are asked to submit a one page journal reflecting on their experience of the Global Enterprise Experience. For the Journal awards, students are evaluated on the quality of their journal as well as comments from colleagues and other evidence about the student’s contribution to the team effort. Bishop's Medal Hutt International Boys' School December 2010 The Bishop's Medal is awarded to one student each year for an outstanding contribution to the special character of Hutt International Boys' School. Deans List 2013 Victoria University of Wellington January 2014 The Dean's List celebrates excellence in academic achievement for those students enrolled in an undergraduate degree programme at Victoria University of Wellington. 
 
To qualify: students must be enrolled for at least 100 undergraduate points taken over a period that begins in Trimester Three of the previous year and ends at the conclusion of Trimester Two of the current year; achieve a grade point average of 7.5 or higher; have not failed any of their courses during the period of study.
